Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> 50% was mined, 50% was staked. The PoP algorithm keeps that level

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <gigamesh> @Oink tell me about the timelock pls

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> All blocks with a value over 192VSRC were timelocked and released at a random point within 24 months each.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> This is done to gradually release the early coins, not to flood the economy

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <Oink> The actual schedule of release was:
```
Era 1:
Block 0 - 10080 reward: 0 to 384, rising linearly and changing each block
Era 2:
Block 10080 - 53279 reward: 384 Block 53280 - 96479 reward: 192 Block 96480 - 139679 reward: 96 Block 139680 - 182879 reward: 48 Block 182880 - 226079 reward: 24
Era 3:
Block 226080 - 1277279 reward: 24
Block 1277280 - 2328479 reward: 12
Block 2328480 - 3379679 reward: 6
. . . halving indefinitely every 1051200 blocks (approximately 2 years)
```

Now CPU mining is profitable (depending on energy prices) and the hashpower is more decentralized. Affordable FPGA‚Äôs with competitive MH/W ratios can stimulate decentralization.
